Text saved: Some cities have tried to encourage artists to stop painting graffiti, which is drawing or writing on walls without permission. They do this by giving artists special areas where they can work. Taiwan, for example, has created “graffiti zones” where artists can paint and write on walls legally. In São Paulo, Brazil, the city council has even let some graffiti artists decorate the subway trains.
